original: HEMBERG, Karl Sture Helmer, Ingenjör, Simrishamn, f Simr 23/8 94 av N Hemberg o Karna Svensson, gm Göta Larsson. Studex Lund, fil kand o mag kemi, zoologi o botanik, stud v Tekn Högsk Darmstadt (garverikem.-tekn). Kem h AB Ehrnberg & Sons Läder-fabr Simr 23, driftsing där o AB Nord Läder-fabr Veberöd sed. 34. Stdsflm, led dräts.kamm, folksk.styr. Huv.m Simr sparbk, styr.-suppl AB Nord Läderfabr, led garv.tekn nmd l Sv Garv.idk.frn, ordf Skand sekt av Int Verein Lederindustrie Chemiker. Resor: Tyskl, Engl, Belg 22, 23, 34. Av trycket: Kap »Läderberedning» o »Garveriindustri», medarb i Sv Uppslagsbok.
translated: HEMBERG, Karl Sture Helmer, Engineer, Simrishamn, born in Simrishamn on August 23, 1894, son of N Hemberg and Karna Svensson, married to Göta Larsson. Graduated from Lund University, Bachelor and Master of Chemistry, Zoology, and Botany. Studied at Darmstadt University of Technology (specializing in tanning chemistry and technology). Worked as a chemist at Ehrnberg & Sons Leather Factory in Simrishamn from 1923, and later became the manager. Also worked at Nord Leather Factory in Veberöd from 1934. Involved in local politics as a member of the city council and the school board. Served on the board of Simrishamn Savings Bank and as a board member at Nord Leather Factory. Served as the chairman of the Tanning Technology Committee at the Swedish Tanning Industry Association and was the chairman of the Scandinavian Section of the International Association of Leather Industry Chemists. Traveled to Germany, England, and Belgium in 1922, 1923, and 1934. Published articles in leather processing and tanning industry, and contributed to the Swedish Encyclopedia.

memberOf.name: International Association of Leather Industry Chemists
